bit_ranges.name: TRNG_FLUSH
bit_ranges.description:
Flush TRNG
Software write 1 to start. When finishes, the core will clear it.

bit_ranges.name: TRNG_START
bit_ranges.description:
Start TRNG
Software write 1 to start. When finishes, the core will clear it.

bit_ranges.name: PKA_FLUSH
bit_ranges.description:
Software write 1 to start Flush Process.The process will  clear
BRFIFO, BTFIFO, and state machine. Then Software should write 0
to end  FLUSH Process

bit_ranges.name: HASH_FLUSH
bit_ranges.description:
Software write 1 to start Flush Process. The process will  clear
BRFIFO, BTFIFO, and state machine. Then Software should write 0
to end  FLUSH Process

bit_ranges.name: BLOCK_FLUSH
bit_ranges.description:
Software write 1 to start Flush Process. The process will  clear
BRFIFO, BTFIFO, and state machine. Then Software should write 0
to end  FLUSH Process. It must last for at least 20 cycles to clean
registers and  FSM

bit_ranges.name: PKA_START
bit_ranges.description:
Starts/initializes PKA
Software write 1 to start. When finishes, the core will clear it.

bit_ranges.name: HASH_START
bit_ranges.description:
Starts/initializes HASH/PRNG/HMAC
Software write 1 to start. When finishes, the core will clear it.

bit_ranges.name: BLOCK_START
bit_ranges.description:
Starts/initializes Block Cipher
Software write 1 to start. When finishes, the core will clear it.

bit_ranges.name: TDES_START
bit_ranges.description:
Starts/initializes TDES
Software write 1 to start. When finishes, the core will clear it.

bit_ranges.name: AES_START
bit_ranges.description:
Starts/initializes AES
Software write 1 to start. When finishes, the core will clear it.

bit_ranges.name: BYTESWAP_HRFIFO
bit_ranges.description:
If this bit is high, then the data read from the bus is byte-swapped
in a word boundary.  If this bit is low (default), then the data is
handed over to the FIFO without byte-swap. For little endian bus,
this bit should be 1'b1.

bit_ranges.name: BYTESWAP_BTFIFO
bit_ranges.description:
If this bit is high, then the data read from the bus is byte-swapped
in a word boundary.  If this bit is low (default), then the data is
handed over to the FIFO without byte-swap. For little endian bus,
this bit should be 1'b1.

bit_ranges.name: BYTESWAP_BRFIFO
bit_ranges.description:
If this bit is high, then the data read from the bus is byte-swapped
in a word boundary.  If this bit is low (default), then the data is
handed over to the FIFO without byte-swap. For little endian bus,
this bit should be 1'b1.

bit_ranges.description:
Change the Big-endian and Little-endian by swapping the byte
oder.
0 = Disables Tweak Value byte swap
1 = Enables Tweak Valuebyte swap

bit_ranges.name: AES_BYTESWAP_TKEY
bit_ranges.description:
Change the Big-endian and Little-endian by swapping the byte
oder.
0 = Disables Tweak Key byte swap
1 = Enables Tweak Key byte swap

bit_ranges.name: AES_BYTESWAP_CNT
bit_ranges.description:
Change the Big-endian and Little-endian by swapping the byte
oder.
0 = Disables Counter data byte swap
1 = Enables Counter data byte swap

bit_ranges.name: AES_BYTESWAP_KEY
bit_ranges.description:
Change the Big-endian and Little-endian by swapping the byte
oder.
0 = Disables Key byte swap
1 = Enables Key byte swap

bit_ranges.name: AES_BYTESWAP_IV
bit_ranges.description:

oder.

bit_ranges.name: AES_BYTESWAP_DO
bit_ranges.description:

oder.

bit_ranges.name: AES_BYTESWAP_DI
bit_ranges.description:

bit_ranges.name: AES_KEYCHANGE
bit_ranges.description:
Specifies the AES key change mode selection signal.
When the bit is asserted, it will not do key-expansion function to
calculate new sub-key. So it is a faster way, when several times of
calculation use the same key. But if the keys are different,
asserting this bit will have the wrong result.
0 = Key is not changed
1 = Key is changed

bit_ranges.name: AES_CHAINMODE
bit_ranges.description:
Specifies AES chain mode selection
00 = ECB mode
01 = CBC mode
10 = CTR mode
11 = XTS mode

bit_ranges.name: AES_KEYSIZE
bit_ranges.description:
Specifies the AES key size selection signal
00 : 128-bit key
01 : 192-bit key
10 : 256-bit key

bit_ranges.name: AES_FIFOMODE
bit_ranges.description:
Specify AES Fifo Mode
1'b0:  Slave mode
1'b1:  fifo  mode

bit_ranges.name: AES_ENC
bit_ranges.description:
Specifies the Encryption/ Decryption mode selection signal
0 : Encryption
1 : Decryption

bit_ranges.name: AES_DONE
bit_ranges.description:
When AES finish, it will be HIGH, And it will not be LOW until it
restart .
1: done
0: not done

bit_ranges.name: TDES_BYTESWAP_KEY
bit_ranges.description:

bit_ranges.name: TDES_BYTESWAP_IV
bit_ranges.description:

bit_ranges.name: TDES_BYTESWAP_DO

bit_ranges.name: TDES_BYTESWAP_DI
bit_ranges.description:

bit_ranges.name: TDES_CHAINMODE

bit_ranges.name: TDES_EEE
bit_ranges.description:

bit_ranges.name: TDES_FIFOMODE
bit_ranges.description:

bit_ranges.name: TDES_ENC
bit_ranges.description:

0 : Encryption
1 : Decryption

bit_ranges.name: TDES_DONE
bit_ranges.description:
When DES/TDES finishes, it will be HIGH, And it will not be LOW
until it restart .
1: done
0: not done

bit_ranges.name: HASH_SWAP_DO
bit_ranges.description:
Specifies the Byte swap of data output (hash result)
0 = Does not swap (default)
1 = Swap

bit_ranges.name: HASH_DONE
bit_ranges.description:
Hash Done Signal
When HASH finishes, it will be HIGH, And it will not be LOW until it
restart
1'b1 : done
1'b0 : not done

bit_ranges.name: OSC_ENABLE
bit_ranges.description:
osc_ring enable
It controls the running of osc_ring. And it is independent of clock
and flush signal. This mean that it can run even when clock is
gating or flush is asserted as long as osc_enable is asserted.
Before it is used to get TRNG result , please run osc_ring first to
get enough entropy.
1'b1: Enable ;
1'b0: Disable ;

bit_ranges.name: PERIOD
bit_ranges.description:
sample period TRNG use clock_crypto to sample ring osc output,
this parameter is specify how many cycles to generate 1 bit
random data.

bit_ranges.name: BLOCK_SIZE
bit_ranges.description:
PKA Size
It specifies the bits of N in PKA calculation.
2'b00: 512 bit
2'b01: 1024 bit
2'b10: 2048 bit

bit_ranges.name: KEY_SECURE
bit_ranges.description:
0 =  AES key ,tkey and DES  key are non-secure
1 =  AES key ,tkey and DES  key are secure

bit_ranges.name: AES_CLK_GATE
bit_ranges.description:
0= AES clock is gated
1= AES clock is not gated

bit_ranges.name: HASH_CLK_GATE
bit_ranges.description:
0= HASH clock is gated
1= HASH clock is not gated

bit_ranges.name: TDES_CLK_GATE
bit_ranges.description:
0= TDES clock is gated
1= TDES clock is not gated

bit_ranges.name: RSA_CLK_GATE
bit_ranges.description:
0= RSA clock is gated
1= RSA clock is not gated

bit_ranges.name: M
bit_ranges.description:
PKA input or output data.
PKA result = (M ^ E) mod N.
When it finishes, the result data is in M position. Start from PKA_M
base address, and may contain 512/1024/2048 bits data.

bit_ranges.name: C
bit_ranges.description: PKA pre-calculate data, C = 2 ^(2n+2) mod N

bit_ranges.name: SHUTDOWNZ
bit_ranges.description:
Field0000 Abstract
This bit configures the core either to power up or to reset.
shutdownz is
the soft reset register. Its default value is 0. After the core
configuration,
to enable the DSI HOST, set this register to 1.

bit_ranges.name: TO_CLK_DIVISION
bit_ranges.description:
to_clk_division
This field indicates the division factor for the Time Out clock used as
the timing unit in the configuration of HS to LP and LP to HS
transition
error.

bit_ranges.name: TX_ESC_CLK_DIVISION
bit_ranges.description:
tx_esc_clk_division
This field indicates the division factor for the TX Escape clock source
(lanebyteclk). The values 0 and 1 stop the TX_ESC clock
generation.

bit_ranges.name: DPI_VCID
bit_ranges.description:
dpi_vcid
This field configures the DPI virtual channel id that is indexed to the
Video mode packets.

bit_ranges.description:
Field0001 Abstract
When set to 1, this bit activates loosely packed variant to 18-bit
configurations.

bit_ranges.name: DPI_COLOR_CODING
bit_ranges.description:
dpi_color_coding
This field configures the DPI color coding as follows:
■0000: 16-bit configuration 1
■0001: 16-bit configuration 2
■0010: 16-bit configuration 3
■0011: 18-bit configuration 1
■0100: 18-bit configuration 2
■0101: 24-bit
■0110: 20-bit YCbCr 4:2:2 loosely packed
■0111: 24-bit YCbCr 4:2:2
■1000: 16-bit YCbCr 4:2:2
■1001: 30-bit
■1010: 36-bit
■1011-1111: 12-bit YCbCr 4:2:0

bit_ranges.name: COLORM_ACTIVE_LOW
bit_ranges.description:
Field0001 Abstract
When set to 1, this bit configures the color mode pin (dpicolorm) as
active low.

bit_ranges.name: SHUTD_ACTIVE_LOW
bit_ranges.description:
Field0001 Abstract
When set to 1, this bit configures the shutdown pin (dpishutdn) as
active low.

bit_ranges.name: HSYNC_ACTIVE_LOW
bit_ranges.description:
Field0001 Abstract
When set to 1, this bit configures the horizontal synchronism pin
(dpihsync) as active low.

bit_ranges.name: VSYNC_ACTIVE_LOW
bit_ranges.description:
Field0001 Abstract
When set to 1, this bit configures the vertical synchronism pin
(dpivsync) as active low.

bit_ranges.name: DATAEN_ACTIVE_LOW
bit_ranges.description:
Field0000 Abstract
When set to 1, this bit configures the data enable pin (dpidataen) as
active low.

bit_ranges.description:
outvact_lpcmd_time
This field is used for the transmission of commands in low-power
mode. It defines the size, in bytes, of the largest packet that can fit
in a
line during the VSA, VBP, and VFP regions.

bit_ranges.name: INVACT_LPCMD_TIME
bit_ranges.description:
invact_lpcmd_time
This field is used for the transmission of commands in low-power
mode. It defines the size, in bytes, of the largest packet that can fit
in a
line during the VACT region.

eotp_rx_en

vid_mode_type

■01: Non-burst with sync events

bit_ranges.name: VID_PKT_SIZE
bit_ranges.description:
vid_pkt_size
This field configures the number of pixels in a single video packet.
For 18-bit not loosely packed data types, this number must be a
multiple of 4. For YCbCr data types, it must be a multiple of 2, as
described in the DSI specification.

bit_ranges.name: VID_NUM_CHUNKS
bit_ranges.description:
vid_num_chunks
This register configures the number of chunks to be transmitted
during
a Line period (a chunk consists of a video packet and a null packet).
If set to 0 or 1, the video line is transmitted in a single packet.
If set to 1, the packet is part of a chunk, so a null packet follows it
if
vid_null_size > 0. Otherwise, multiple chunks are used to transmit
each video line.

bit_ranges.name: VID_NULL_SIZE
bit_ranges.description:
vid_null_size
This register configures the number of bytes inside a null packet.
Setting it to 0 disables the null packets.

vid_hbp_time

bit_ranges.name: HSTX_TO_CNT
bit_ranges.description:
hstx_to_cnt
This field configures the timeout counter that triggers a high-speed
transmission timeout contention detection (measured in
TO_CLK_DIVISION cycles).
If using the non-burst mode and there is no sufficient time to switch
from HS to LP and back in the period which is from one line data
finishing to the next line sync start, the DSI link returns the LP state
once per frame, then you should configure the TO_CLK_DIVISION
and hstx_to_cnt to be in accordance with:
hstx_to_cnt * lanebyteclkperiod * TO_CLK_DIVISION >= the time
of one FRAME data transmission * (1 + 10%)
In burst mode, RGB pixel packets are time-compressed, leaving
more time during a scan line. Therefore, if in burst mode and there
is sufficient time to switch from HS to LP and back in the period of
time from one line data finishing to the next line sync start, the DSI
link can return LP mode and back in this time interval to save
power. For this, configure the TO_CLK_DIVISION and hstx_to_cnt
to be in accordance with:
hstx_to_cnt * lanebyteclkperiod * TO_CLK_DIVISION >= the time
of one LINE data transmission * (1 + 10%)

bit_ranges.name: LPRX_TO_CNT
bit_ranges.description:
lprx_to_cnt
This field configures the timeout counter that triggers a low-power
reception timeout contention detection (measured in
TO_CLK_DIVISION cycles).

registers.name: MIPI_DSI_HOST_HS_RD_TO_CNT

bit_ranges.name: HS_RD_TO_CNT
bit_ranges.description:
hs_rd_to_cnt
This field sets a period for which the DWC_mipi_dsi_host keeps the
link still, after sending a high-speed read operation. This period is
measured in cycles of lanebyteclk. The counting starts when the
D-PHY enters the Stop state and causes no interrupts.

registers.description: Peripheral Response Timeout Definition after Hi

registers.name: MIPI_DSI_HOST_LP_RD_TO_CNT

bit_ranges.name: LP_RD_TO_CNT
bit_ranges.description:
lp_rd_to_cnt
This field sets a period for which the DSI HOST keeps the link still,
after sending a low-power read operation. This period is measured
in cycles of lanebyteclk. The counting starts when theD-PHY enters
the Stop state and causes no interrupts.

registers.description: Peripheral Response Timeout Definition after Lo

registers.name: MIPI_DSI_HOST_HS_WR_TO_CNT

bit_ranges.name: PRESP_TO_MODE
bit_ranges.description:
presp_to_mode
When set to 1, this bit ensures that the peripheral response timeout
caused by hs_wr_to_cnt is used only once per eDPI frame, when
both the following conditions are met:
■dpivsync_edpiwms has risen and fallen.
■Packets originated from eDPI have been transmitted and its FIFO
is empty again.
In this scenario no non-eDPI requests are sent to the D-PHY, even
if there is traffic from generic, making it return to
stop state. When it does so, PRESP_TO counter is activated and
only when it finishes does the controller send any other traffic that
is ready.

bit_ranges.name: HS_WR_TO_CNT
bit_ranges.description:
hs_wr_to_cnt
This field sets a period for which the DSI HOST keeps the
link inactive after sending a high-speed write operation. This period
is measured in cycles of lanebyteclk. The counting starts when the
D-PHY enters the Stop state and causes no interrupts.

registers.description: Peripheral Response Timeout Definition after Hi

registers.name: MIPI_DSI_HOST_LP_WR_TO_CNT

bit_ranges.name: LP_WR_TO_CNT
bit_ranges.description:
lp_wr_to_cnt
This field sets a period for which the DSI HOST keeps the
link still, after sending a low-power write operation. This period is
measured in cycles of lanebyteclk. The counting starts when the
D-PHY enters the Stop state and causes no interrupts.

registers.description: Peripheral Response Timeout Definition after Lo

registers.name: MIPI_DSI_HOST_BTA_TO_CNT

bit_ranges.name: BTA_TO_CNT
bit_ranges.description:
bta_to_cnt
This field sets a period for which the DWC_mipi_dsi_host keeps the
link still, after completing a Bus Turn-Around. This period is
measured in cycles of lanebyteclk. The counting starts when the
D-PHY enters the Stop state and causes no interrupts.

registers.description: Peripheral Response Timeout Definition after B

registers.description: D-PHY Data Lanes Timing Configuration Registe

bit_ranges.name: PHY_FORCEPLL
bit_ranges.description:
phy_forcepll

Dependency: DSI_HOST_FPGA = 0. Otherwise, this bit is reserved.

bit_ranges.name: PHY_ENABLECLK
bit_ranges.description:

■11: Four data lanes (lanes 0, 1, 2, and 3)

bit_ranges.description:
phy_direction
This bit indicates the status of phydirection D-PHY signal.

bit_ranges.name: PHY_LOCK
bit_ranges.description:
phy_lock
This bit indicates the status of phylock D-PHY signal.

bit_ranges.name: PHY_TESTCLK
bit_ranges.description:
phy_testclk
This bit is used to clock the TESTDIN bus into the D-PHY.

bit_ranges.name: PHY_TESTCLR
bit_ranges.description:
phy_testclr
PHY test interface clear (active high).

bit_ranges.name: PHY_TESTEN
bit_ranges.description:
phy_testen
PHY test interface operation selector:
■1: The address write operation is set on the falling edge of the
testclk signal.
■0: The data write operation is set on the rising edge of the testclk
signal.

bit_ranges.name: PHT_TESTDOUT
bit_ranges.description:
pht_testdout
PHY output 8-bit data bus for read-back and internal probing
functionalities.

bit_ranges.name: PHY_TESTDIN
bit_ranges.description:
phy_testdin
PHY test interface input 8-bit data bus for internal register
programming and test functionalities access.

bit_ranges.name: DPHY_ERRORS_4
bit_ranges.description:
dphy_errors_4
This bit indicates the LP1 contention error ErrContentionLP1 from
Lane 0.

bit_ranges.name: DPHY_ERRORS_3
bit_ranges.description:
dphy_errors_3
This bit indicates the LP0 contention error ErrContentionLP0 from
Lane 0.

bit_ranges.name: DPHY_ERRORS_2
bit_ranges.description:
dphy_errors_2
This bit indicates the ErrControl error from Lane 0.

bit_ranges.name: DPHY_ERRORS_1
bit_ranges.description:
dphy_errors_1
This bit indicates ErrSyncEsc low-power data transmission
synchronization error from Lane 0.

bit_ranges.name: DPHY_ERRORS_0
bit_ranges.description:
dphy_errors_0
This bit indicates ErrEsc escape entry error from Lane 0.

bit_ranges.name: ACK_WITH_ERR_15
bit_ranges.description:
ack_with_err_15
This bit retrieves the DSI protocol violation from the Acknowledge
error report.

bit_ranges.description:

This bit retrieves the checksum error (long packet only) from the
Acknowledge error report.

bit_ranges.description:
ack_with_err_9
This bit retrieves the ECC error, multi-bit (detected, not corrected)

This bit retrieves the Escape Mode Entry Command error from the

bit_ranges.name: GEN_PLD_RECEV_ERR
bit_ranges.description:
gen_pld_recev_err
This bit indicates that during a generic interface packet read back,
the payload FIFO becomes full and the received data is corrupted.

bit_ranges.name: GEN_PLD_RD_ERR
bit_ranges.description:
gen_pld_rd_err
This bit indicates that during a DCS read data, the payload FIFO
becomes empty and the data sent to the interface is corrupted.

bit_ranges.name: GEN_PLD_SEND_ERR
bit_ranges.description:
gen_pld_send_err
This bit indicates that during a Generic interface packet build, the
payload FIFO becomes empty and corrupt data is sent.

bit_ranges.name: GEN_PLD_WR_ERR
bit_ranges.description:
gen_pld_wr_err
This bit indicates that the system tried to write a payload data
through the Generic interface and the FIFO is full. Therefore, the
payload is not written.

bit_ranges.name: GEN_CMD_WR_ERR
bit_ranges.description:
gen_cmd_wr_err
This bit indicates that the system tried to write a command through
the Generic interface and the FIFO is full. Therefore, the command
is not written.

bit_ranges.name: DPI_PLD_WR_ERR
bit_ranges.description:
dpi_pld_wr_err
This bit indicates that during a DPI pixel line storage, the payload
FIFO becomes full and the data stored is corrupted.

bit_ranges.name: EOPT_ERR
bit_ranges.description:
eopt_err
This bit indicates that the EoTp packet is not received at the end of
the incoming peripheral transmission.

bit_ranges.name: PKT_SIZE_ERR
bit_ranges.description:
pkt_size_err
This bit indicates that the packet size error is detected during the
packet reception

bit_ranges.name: CRC_ERR
bit_ranges.description:
crc_err
This bit indicates that the CRC error is detected in the received
packet payload.

bit_ranges.name: ECC_MULTI_ERR
bit_ranges.description:
ecc_multi_err
This bit indicates that the ECC multiple error is detected in a
received error.

bit_ranges.name: ECC_SINGLE_ERR
bit_ranges.description:
ecc_single_err
This bit indicates that the ECC single error is detected and corrected
in a received packet.

bit_ranges.name: TO_LP_RX
bit_ranges.description:
to_lp_rx
This bit indicates that the low-power reception timeout counter
reached the end and contention is detected.

bit_ranges.name: TO_HS_TX
bit_ranges.description:
to_hs_tx
This bit indicates that the high-speed transmission timeout counter
reached the end and contention is detected.

bit_ranges.name: PROD_NUM
bit_ranges.description:
product number
The ascii code of "hv", which is 0x6876

bit_ranges.name: CODEC_FLAG
bit_ranges.description:
codec flag
0: only dec
1: dec + enc

bit_ranges.name: DEC_SUPPORT
bit_ranges.description:
dec support bits
bit0: HEVC support or not, when it is 1'b1, support
bit1: H264 support or not
bit2: VP9 support or not

bit_ranges.name: SW_SOFTRESET_RDY
bit_ranges.description: when it is 1'b1, it says that softreset has been done

bit_ranges.name: SW_SOFTRST_EN_P
bit_ranges.description:
softreset enable
softreset enable signal
write 1 to soft reset, write 0 invalid
puls register

bit_ranges.name: SW_H264ORVP9_ERROR_MODE
bit_ranges.description:
h264 or vp9 error mode
for VP9:
1'b0: when there is any stream or colmv error, the hardware will
stop the decode and reset itself
1'b1: when there is any stream or colmv error, the hardware will
still decode the next slice
it is recommend that when vp9 , it is configed to 1'b0
for H264:
1'b0: when there is any stream , the hardware will stop the decoder
and reset itself
1'b1: when there is any stream error,  the hardware will wait the
end signal of deblocking and then reset itself

bit_ranges.name: SW_CABU_END_STA
bit_ranges.description:
cabac decode end status
hevc: cabac decode end status
h264& vp9 : streamd decode status

bit_ranges.name: SW_COLMV_REF_ERROR_STA
bit_ranges.description:
colmv ref error status
colmv ref error status
hevc&vp9: when it is 1'b1, it means that inter module read the
invalid dpb frame
It will self reset the hardware
h264: when it is 1'b1, it means that inter module read the invalid
dpb frame. when sw_h264_error_mode is 1'b0, it will self reset the
hardware, otherwise it will not

bit_ranges.name: SW_BUF_EMPTY_STA
bit_ranges.description:
buffer empty sta
buffer empty status, only when sw_buf_empty_en is 1'b1 , this bit
is valid, now is for no valid

bit_ranges.name: SW_DEC_TIMEOUT_STA
bit_ranges.description:
decoder timeout interrupt status
When high the decoder has been idling for too long. it will self reset
the hardware
only when sw_dec_timeout_e is 1'b1, this bit is valid

bit_ranges.name: SW_DEC_ERROR_STA
bit_ranges.description:
status bit of input stream error
hevc & vp9:when high, an error is found in input data stream
decoding. It will self reset the hardware.
h264: when high, an error is found in input data stream
decoding.when sw_h264_error_mode is 1'b0, it will self reset the
hardware, otherwise it will not

bit_ranges.name: SW_DEC_BUS_STA
bit_ranges.description:
bus error  status
When this bit is high, there is error on the axi bus, it will self reset
hardware

bit_ranges.name: SW_DEC_RDY_STA
bit_ranges.description:
decoder ready status
when this bit is high, decoder has decoded a picture( the loop filter
module send out a frame rdy)

bit_ranges.name: SW_DEC_E_REWRITE_VALID
bit_ranges.description:
sw_de_e rewrite valid signal
sw_dec_e rewrite valid signal
maybe for only when buffer empty, restart the decoder use

bit_ranges.name: SW_DEC_IRQ_RAW
bit_ranges.description:
the raw status of sw_dec_irq
the raw status of sw_dec_irq,SW should reset this bit after
interrupt is handled

bit_ranges.name: SW_DEC_IRQ
bit_ranges.description:
decoder IRQ
when high,  decoder requests an interrrupt.
sw_dec_irq = sw_dec_irq_raw && (sw_dec_irq_dis == 1'b0)

bit_ranges.name: SW_STMERROR_WAITDECFIFO_EMPTY
bit_ranges.description:
whether the stream error process wait the decfifo empty
when it is 1'b0, the stream error process will no wait the ca2decfifo
empty
when it is 1'b1, the stream error process will wait the ca2decfifo
empty
when sw_dec_mode is HEVC and VP9, it always take effect; when
sw_dec_mode is H264, it only take effect when
sw_h264_error_mode is 1'b0

bit_ranges.name: SW_BUF_EMPTY_EN
bit_ranges.description:
buffer empty int enable
buffer empty interrupt enable, now is for no use

bit_ranges.name: SW_DEC_TIMEOUT_E
bit_ranges.description:
Timeout interrupt enable
If enabled HW may return timeout interrupt in case HW gets
stucked while decoding picture.

bit_ranges.name: SW_DEC_IRQ_DIS
bit_ranges.description:
decoder IRQ disable
When hight, there are no interrupts concerning decoder from HW.
Polling must be  used to see the interrupt status

bit_ranges.name: SW_TIMEOUT_MODE
bit_ranges.description:
time out mode
timeout mode select
1'b0:  TIMEOUT_CYCLES is 241'b1
1'b1:  TIMEOUT_CYCLES is 181'b1

bit_ranges.name: SW_DEC_CLKGATE_E
bit_ranges.description:
decoder dynamic clock gating enable
0 = clock is running for all structures
1 = clock is gated for decoder structures that are not used

bit_ranges.name: SW_DEC_E
bit_ranges.description:
decoder enable
Decoder enable. Setting this bit high will start the decoding
operation. HW will reset this when the picture is decoded ready or
bus error or time out interrupt is given for all decode format.
HW will reset this when picture is processed stream error for vp9 &
hevc & (h264 when sw_h264_error_mode is 1'b0)

registers.name: RKVDEC_SWREG2_SYSCTRL

bit_ranges.name: SW_H264_FRAME_ORSLICE
bit_ranges.description:
h264 frame or slice
for H264 use
1'b0: frame
1'b1: slice
when sw_h264_streamd_mode is 1'b0, this register is valid

bit_ranges.name: SW_H264_FIRSTSLICE_FLAG
bit_ranges.description:
firstslice flag
1'b1: first packet in the frame, for h264 decode to read rps/pps
data
because the first_mb_in_slice may be wrong, so need this syntax

bit_ranges.name: SW_H264_STREAM_LASTPACKET
bit_ranges.description:
stream last packet flag
when sw_h264_stream_mode is 1'b1
sw_h264_stream_lastpacket 1'b0: this packet is not the last packet
of frame
1'b1: the packet is the last packet of frame

bit_ranges.name: SW_H264_STREAM_MODE
bit_ranges.description:
h264 stream mode
1'b0: stream packet is slice by slice or frame by frame, should use
sw_h264_frame_orslice
1'b1: stream packet is random, should use sw_h264_stream_last

bit_ranges.name: SW_H264_RPS_MODE
bit_ranges.description:
h264 rps mode
1'b0: hardware parse rps mode
1'b1: software parse rps mode

bit_ranges.name: SW_STRM_START_BIT
bit_ranges.description:
exact bit of stream start
exact bit of streamd start word where decoding can be started
(asosiates with sw_str_rlc_base)

bit_ranges.name: SW_RLC_MODE
bit_ranges.description:
rlc mode enable
0 = HW decodes video from bit stream
1 = HW decodes video from RLC input data

bit_ranges.name: SW_RLC_MODE_DIRECT_WRITE
bit_ranges.description:
cabac decode output direct write
cabac decode output direct write enable
when this bit is enable , all the module other than cabac and busifd
are not work

bit_ranges.name: SW_OUT_CBCR_SWAP
bit_ranges.description:
output cbcr swap
1'b0:  cb(u) is in the lower address, cr(v) is in the higher address
1'b1:  cb(u) is in the higher address,cr(v) is in the lower address
sw_in_cbcr_swap is the same with sw_out_cbcr_swap

bit_ranges.name: SW_OUT_SWAP32_E
bit_ranges.description:
decoder output data and dpb input data 32bit swap
may be used for 64 or 128 bit environment
0 = no swapping of 32 bit words
1 = 32 bit data words are swapped

bit_ranges.name: SW_OUT_ENDIAN
bit_ranges.description:
dec output data and colmv , dpb data and colmv input endian
0 = little endian
1 = big endian
for litter enadian , a data 0x12345678, 0x78 is stored in lower
address, 0x12 is stored in higher address

bit_ranges.name: SW_STR_SWAP64_E
bit_ranges.description:
stream 64bit data swap
may be used for 128 bit environment
0 = no swapping of 64 bit words
1 = 64 bit data words are swapped

bit_ranges.name: SW_STR_SWAP32_E
bit_ranges.description:
stream  32bit data swap
may be used for 64 or 128 bit environment
0 = no swapping of 32 bit words
1 = 32 bit data words are swapped

bit_ranges.name: SW_STR_ENDIAN
bit_ranges.description:
stream data input endian mode
0 = little endian
1 = big endian
for litter enadian , a data 0x12345678, 0x78 is stored in lower
address, 0x12 is stored in higher address

bit_ranges.name: SW_IN_SWAP64_E
bit_ranges.description:
input 64bit data swap for other than stream and dpb data
may be used for 128 bit environment
0 = no swapping of 64 bit words
1 = 64 bit data words are swapped

bit_ranges.name: SW_IN_SWAP32_E
bit_ranges.description:
input 32bit data swap for other than stream and dpb data
may be used for 64 or 128 bit environment
0 = no swapping of 32 bit words
1 = 32 bit data words are swapped

bit_ranges.name: SW_IN_ENDIAN
bit_ranges.description:
decoder input endian mode for other than stream and dpb data
0 = little endian
1 = big endian
for litter enadian , a data 0x12345678, 0x78 is stored in lower
address, 0x12 is stored in higher address

registers.description: Data input and output endian setting and sys ctrl

bit_ranges.name: SW_SLICE_NUM_LOWBITS
bit_ranges.description:
slice number in a frame
hevc:slice number in a frame (0~199, when it is 0, it real means 1
slice in a frame)
just only used for rps read.
2013.11.27 change the meaning from count from 1, so it will be in
1~200
2013.11.30 sw_slice_num max value is change to 600, so
sw_slice_num expand to 10bit
h264:slice number in a frame (0~4095, when it is 1, it real means
1 slice in a frame), for H264, it means sw_slice_num_lowbits
vp9: no use

bit_ranges.name: SW_UV_HOR_VIRSTRIDE
bit_ranges.description:
uv horizontal virstride
picture horizontal virtual stride (the unit is 128bit)
the max is (4096x1.5 + 128) /16 = 0x188
suggest this register to config to even for advance ddr performance

bit_ranges.name: SW_SLICE_NUM_HIGHBIT
bit_ranges.description:
the highest bit of sw_slice_num
the highest bit of sw_slice_num

bit_ranges.name: SW_Y_HOR_VIRSTRIDE
bit_ranges.description:
picture horizontal virtual stride

suggest this register to config to even for advance ddr performance

bit_ranges.name: SW_STRM_RLC_BASE
bit_ranges.description:
the stream or rlc data base address
when swreg2.sw_rlc_mode =1, it is base address for rlc data
when swreg2.sw_rlc_mode =0, it is base address for stream , after
a frame is decoded ready or error (stream error , time out , bus
error) , it is the last address of the stream
the address should 128bit align

registers.description: the stream or rlc data base address

registers.name: RKVDEC_SWREG5_STREAM_RLC_LEN

bit_ranges.name: SW_STREAM_LEN
bit_ranges.description:
amount of stream (unit is 8bit)  in the input buffer
amount of stream 8bits in the input buffer
the max of sw_stream_len : 4096x2304x1.5x1.5 = 0x1440000
128bits unit: 0x1440000/16 = 0x144000
it is count from 0
2013.10.15 change to 23bit for zty's suggestion
2013.10.28, amount of stream data bytes in input buffer.
it is count from 1, change to 27bits

registers.description: amount of stream bytes or rlc data byte in the input buffer or the

we can know the sw_uvout_base = sw_decout_base +

the ouput picture yuv virtual stride

the max : (4096x1.5 +128) x 2304 x1.5 = 0x14ac000
we can know the sw_mvout_base = sw_decout_base +
(sw_yuv_virstride <<4)

bit_ranges.name: SW_VP9_FRAME_REFERENCE_MODE
bit_ranges.description:
frame_reference_mode
frame_reference_mode specifies frame reference mode.
SINGLE_REFERENCE= 0,
COMPOUND_REFERENCE= 1,
REFERENCE_MODE_SELECT= 2,
REFERENCE_MODES= 3,
When frame_reference_mode_flag0 is not present ,it equal to 0 by
default.
When frame_reference_mode_flag1 is not present ,it equal to 0 by
default.
frame_reference_mode = frame_reference_mode_flag0 == 0 ?
frame_reference_mode_flag1 == 0 ?
REFERENCE_MODE_SELECT : COMPOUND_REFERENCE) :
SINGLE_REFERENCE

bit_ranges.name: SW_VP9_TX_MODE
bit_ranges.description:
tx_mode
tx_mode specifies frame transform mode.
ONLY_4X4            = 0,        // only 4x4 transform used
ALLOW_8X8           = 1,        // allow block transform size up
to 8x8
ALLOW_16X16         = 2,        // allow block transform size
up to 16x16
ALLOW_32X32         = 3,        // allow block transform size
up to 32x32
TX_MODE_SELECT      = 4,        // transform specified for
each block

sw_strmd_error_e[1] is for sw_vp9_segskip_error

vp9_error_info0[1:0] is to tell tile_rows_cnt[1:0]
vp9_error_info0[3:2] is to tell the error type
2'b00: no error
2'b01: tilesize error
2'b10: seg skip error
2'b11: ref scale error

registers.description: x-coordinate of mask area 2 for Horizontal start pixel

bit_ranges.name: SW_END_COORDY_MA2
bit_ranges.description:
the start y-coordinate of mask area 2 of Vertical start pixel
range:sw_st_coordy_ma2-dst width

bit_ranges.name: SW_ST_COORDY_MA2
bit_ranges.description: the start y-coordinate of mask area 2 of Vertical start pixel

registers.description: y-coordinate of mask area 2 for Horizontal start pixel

bit_ranges.name: SW_DEINTERL_EDGE
bit_ranges.description:
the edge detect value of deinterlacing
Edge detect value used for deinterlacing

bit_ranges.name: SW_CONT_THR1
bit_ranges.description: the threshold value 1 for contrast adjust

bit_ranges.name: SW_CONT_THR0
bit_ranges.description: the threshold value 0 for contrast adjust

bit_ranges.name: SW_CONT_OFFSET1
bit_ranges.description: the offset value 1 for contrast adjust

bit_ranges.name: SW_CONT_OFFSET0
bit_ranges.description: the offset value 0 for contrast adjust

bit_ranges.name: ABLD_CROP_FLAG
bit_ranges.description:
0: unsupport crop,the exact image of the area being alpha blended
should exist in the external memory
1: supprot crop,one picture in external memory which come from
blended area can be cropped

bit_ranges.name: ACCUT_OUT_EXIST_FLAG
bit_ranges.description:
Pixel Accurate PP output mode exists flag
PIP:
0 : use 8 pixels (width) or 2 pixels (height) steps to adjust Scaling
and masks
1 : use 1 pixel for RGB and 2 pixels for subsampled chroma formats
to adjust Scaling and masks

bit_ranges.name: TILE_EXIST_FLAG
bit_ranges.description:
the output of yuv422 tiled exist flag
0 : no exist
1 : exist

bit_ranges.name: DITHER_EXIST_FLAG
bit_ranges.description:
Dithering exists flag
0 : no exist
1 : exist

bit_ranges.name: SCL_PERF_SEL
bit_ranges.description:
scaling perfomance sel
0 : without scaling
1 : low perfomance scaling
2 : high perfomance scaling
3 : high and fast perfomance scaling

bit_ranges.name: DEINTERL_EXIST_FLAG
bit_ranges.description:
Deinterlacing exits flag
0 : no exist
1 : exist

bit_ranges.name: ABLD_EXIST_FLAG
bit_ranges.description:
alpha blending exists flag
0 : no exist
1 : exist

bit_ranges.name: PP_IN_BUF_SEL
bit_ranges.description:
PP input buffering select
0 : output buffering is 1 MB
1 : output buffering is 4 MB

bit_ranges.name: PP_ENDIAN_MODE
bit_ranges.description:
PP output endian mode select
0 :  Endian mode supported except RGB
1 :  Endian mode supported for all format

bit_ranges.name: PP_OUT_BUF_SEL
bit_ranges.description:
PP output buffering select
0 : output buffering is 1 unit
1 : output buffering is 4 unit

bit_ranges.name: PPD_EXIST_FLAG
bit_ranges.description:
PPD exists flag
0 : no exist
1 : exist

bit_ranges.name: PP_TILE_IN_MODE
bit_ranges.description:
PD input tiled mode
0 : unsupport
1 : 8x4 tile be used

bit_ranges.name: PPD_MAX_OUTW
bit_ranges.description: the max pixels width allow for pp output

bit_ranges.name: SW_PP_INH_EXT
bit_ranges.description:
PP input extended height
in order to support jpeg

bit_ranges.name: SW_PP_INH
bit_ranges.description:
the picture height of PP input with in macro blocks which can be
cropped from a bigger picture when in the condtion of external
mode

bit_ranges.name: SW_ORG_INW_EXT
bit_ranges.description: the orginal width of pp input pic in MBS

bit_ranges.name: SW_PP_INW_EXT
bit_ranges.description:
PP input extended width
in order to support jpeg

bit_ranges.name: SW_PP_INW
bit_ranges.description:
the picture width of PP input with in macro blocks which can be
cropped from a bigger picture when in the condtion of external
mode

bit_ranges.name: SW_PP_OUTH_EXT
bit_ranges.description: the extension height of pp output

bit_ranges.name: SW_PP_OUTH
bit_ranges.description:
(output width = 2*n (n=1,2,......) || output width
=(configurationed Pixel Accurate PP output configuration)*n )
&&
( pp output width < 1920 || pp output width< 3*(sw_pp_inh-8))

bit_ranges.name: SW_PP_OUTW_EXT
bit_ranges.description: the extension width of pp output

bit_ranges.name: SW_PP_OUTW
bit_ranges.description:
the pp output width
(output width = 8*n (n=1,2,......) || output width
=(configurationed Pixel Accurate PP output configuration)*n )
&&
( pp output width < 1920 || pp output width< 3*(sw_pp_inw-8))

bit_ranges.name: SW_DITHER_MODE_B
bit_ranges.description:
the dither mode for B-component
0 : no use dithering
1 : 4-bits dither matrix be used
2 : 5-bits dither matrix be used
3 : 6-bits dither matrix be used

bit_ranges.name: SW_DITHER_MODE_G
bit_ranges.description:
the dither mode for G-component
0 : no use dithering
1 : 4-bits dither matrix be used
2 : 5-bits dither matrix be used
3 : 6-bits dither matrix be used

bit_ranges.name: SW_DITHER_MODE_R
bit_ranges.description:
the dither mode for R-component
0 : no use dithering
1 : 4-bits dither matrix be used
2 : 5-bits dither matrix be used
3 : 6-bits dither matrix be used

bit_ranges.name: SW_PP_IN_DATA_STRC
bit_ranges.description:
the data structure of pp input picture
0 : Top field
1 : Bottom field
2 : Interlaced field
3 : Interlaced frame
4 : Ripped top field
5 : Ripped bottom field
if value=0/1/2,then should read every line from the base address,if
value=3/4/5,then should read every second line from the base
address

bit_ranges.name: SW_PP_OUT_CRBF_EN
bit_ranges.description:
output yuv422 or yuv420,cr before cb
0 : Y0CbY0Cr / CbY0CrY0
1 : Y0CrY0Cb / CrY0CbY0

bit_ranges.name: SW_PP_IN_CRBF_EN
bit_ranges.description:
in yuv422 or yuv420,cr before cb
yuv422:
0 : Y0CbY0Cr / CbY0CrY0
1 : Y0CrY0Cb / CrY0CbY0
yuv420 semiplanar chrominance:
0 : CbCrCbCr
1:CrCbCrCb

bit_ranges.name: SW_PP_OUT_YUV_ORDER
bit_ranges.description:
the output yuv order
0 :  Y0CbY0Cr / Y0CrY0Cb
1 :  CbY0CrY0 / CrY0CbY0

bit_ranges.name: SW_PP_IN_YUV_ORDER
bit_ranges.description:
the input yuv order
0 :  Y0CbY0Cr / Y0CrY0Cb
1 :  CbY0CrY0 / CrY0CbY0

bit_ranges.name: SW_PP_OUT_WORDSP
bit_ranges.description:
the 32bit data swap for pp output data,
it will be used in 64 bit environment
0 : no swapping
1 : swapping high and low 32bit data

bit_ranges.name: SW_PP_OUT_HFWORDSP
bit_ranges.description:
the half word swap inside of word
0:no swap
1:swap
also be used as change pixel orders for 16 bit RGB,support all
output format
require  pp_endian_mode=1

bit_ranges.name: SW_PP_ABLD1_IN_WORDSP
bit_ranges.description:
the 32bit data swap for the input 32bit data swap of Alpha blend
for Alpha blend source 1
0 : no swapping
1 : swapping high and low 32bit data

bit_ranges.name: SW_PP_IN_WORDSP
bit_ranges.description:
the 32bit data swap for pp input data,
it will be used in 64 bit environment
0 : no swapping
1 : swapping high and low 32bit data

bit_ranges.name: SW_RGB_PIX_BITS
bit_ranges.description:
rga bits used sel
0: every word have only one rga pixel
1:every word have two rga pixel

bit_ranges.name: SW_PP_OUT_ENDIAN
bit_ranges.description:
the endian mode of pp output
for all yuv output endian mode or any data when
pp_endian_mode=1
0 :  big endian
1 :  little endian
if pp_endian_mode=0:
16 bit RGB: this bit used as pixel swapping bit
32 bit RGB: no used

bit_ranges.name: SW_PP_ABLD2_IN_ENDIAN
bit_ranges.description:
the endian select for input data of Alpha blend source 2
0: same with sw_pp_in_endian
1: same with sw_pp_abld1_in_endian
'0' = Use PP in endian/swap definitions (sw_pp_in_endian,
sw_pp_in_swap)
'1' = Use Ablend source 1 endian/swap definitions

bit_ranges.name: SW_PP_ABLD1_IN_ENDIAN
bit_ranges.description:
the endian mode of input data for Alpha blend source 1
0 :  big endian  (0-1-2-3)
1 :  little endian (3-2-1-0 )

bit_ranges.name: SW_PP_IN_ENDIAN
bit_ranges.description:
the endian mode of pp input picture when PP in standalone mode
this bit will no to be used when PP is running pipelined with the
decoder
0 :  big endian  (0-1-2-3)
1 :  little endian (3-2-1-0 )

bit_ranges.name: SW_PP_IN_TILMOD
bit_ranges.description:
the tiled mode of pp input data
only support yuv420 input data,can be as pipeline or external mode
0    : Tiled mode not be actived
1    :  8x4 sized tiles be used
2,3 : reserved

bit_ranges.name: SW_PP_IN_FMT_ECP
bit_ranges.description:
Escape PP in format
be actived when sw_pp_in_fmt = 3'b111
0 : YCbCr 4:4:4
1 : YCbCr 4:1:1

bit_ranges.name: SW_PP_OUT_FMT
bit_ranges.description:
0 : RGB
1 : YCbCr 4:2:0   ;  planar (Not supported)
2 : YCbCr 4:2:2   ;  planar (Not supported)
3 : YUYV 4:2:2    ;  interleaved
4 : YCbCr 4:4:4   ;  planar (Not supported)
5 : YCh 4:2:0       ;  chrominance interleaved
6 : YCh 4:2:2       ;  (Not supported)
7 : YCh 4:4:4 (Not supported)

bit_ranges.name: SW_PP_IN_FMT
bit_ranges.description:
the input format of pp input data
0 : YUYV 4:2:2    ;    interleaved and it only supported in
external mode
1 : YCbCr 4:2:0   ;    the format of Semi-planar in linear
raster-scan
2 : YCbCr 4:2:0   ;    planar and it only supported in external
mode
3 : YCbCr 4:0:0   ;    it only supported in pipelined mode
4 : YCbCr 4:2:2   ;    Semi-planar  and it only supported only in
pipelined  mode
5 : YCbCr 4:2:0   ;    Semi-planar in tiled format and it only
supported in external mode
6 : YCbCr 4:4:0   ;     Semi-planar and it only supported for
jpeg in pipelined mode
7 : same as sw_pp_in_fmt_ecp

bit_ranges.name: SW_ROT_MODE
bit_ranges.description:
Rotation mode
0 : rotation disabled
1 : rotate + 90
2 : rotate –90
3 : horizontal flip (mirror)
4 : vertical flip
5 : rotate 180

bit_ranges.name: SW_PP_BUS_STS
bit_ranges.description: the Interrupt status bit for tell sw bus have some error

bit_ranges.name: SW_PP_RDY_STS
bit_ranges.description: the Interrupt status bit for tell sw processed a picture

bit_ranges.name: SW_PP_IRQ_DIS
bit_ranges.description:
the pp finish interrupt request diable flag
1 : use polling to see the interrupt
0 : use sw_pp_irq

bit_ranges.name: SW_PP_IRQ
bit_ranges.description:
the pp finish interrupt request
after sw query this interrupt,shoud write 0 to reset.
this bit will no used in pipeline mode

bit_ranges.name: SW_PP_AHB_HLOCK_EN
bit_ranges.description:
the enable flag for  AHB master HLOCK
the service is locked to pp as long as it needs the bus

bit_ranges.name: SW_RIGHTWD_CROSS_EN
bit_ranges.description:
the enable flag for Right side overcross
0 : disable,
1 : enable

bit_ranges.name: SW_LEFTSD_CROSS_EN
bit_ranges.description:
the enable flag for Left side overcross
0 : disable,
1 : enable

bit_ranges.name: SW_DOWNWD_CROSS_EN
bit_ranges.description:
the enable flag for Downward overcross
0 : disable,
1 : enable

bit_ranges.name: SW_UPWD_CROSS_EN
bit_ranges.description:
the enable flag for Upward overcross
0 : disable,
1 : enable

bit_ranges.name: SW_MASK2_ABLD_EN
bit_ranges.description:
the enable flag for Mask 2 alpha blending
alpha blending for the output picture , only be supported when
data format is RGB/YUYV422
Alpha blending read data from alpha blend 2 base address

bit_ranges.name: SW_MASK1_ABLD_EN
bit_ranges.description:
the enable flag for Mask 1 alpha blending
alpha blending for the output picture , only be supported when
data format is RGB/YUYV422
Alpha blending read data from alpha blend 1 base address

bit_ranges.name: SW_MASK2_EN
bit_ranges.description:
the enable flag  for mask 2
0 : disable,
1 : enable

bit_ranges.name: SW_MASK1_EN
bit_ranges.description:
the enable flag for mask 1
0 : disable,
1 : enable

bit_ranges.name: SW_PP_DISCD_EN
bit_ranges.description:
the enable flag for PP data discard
the burst length will be fix after sw_pp_discd_en=1,and extra read
data will auto be discarded by HW

bit_ranges.name: SW_PP_OUT_TILED_EN
bit_ranges.description:
the enable flag for pp output tiled mode
only used in YCbYCr format .
Tile size :  4x4 pixels.

bit_ranges.name: SW_PP_FDSCL_EN
bit_ranges.description:
the enable flag for fast downscaling
0 : disable
1 : enabled. it will inprove the performance but will decrease the
quality of the pic

bit_ranges.name: SW_RANGEMAP_C_EN
bit_ranges.description: the enable flag for C component Range map

bit_ranges.name: SW_RANGEMAP_Y_EN
bit_ranges.description: the enable flag for Y component Range map

bit_ranges.name: SW_PP_PIPL_EN
bit_ranges.description:
pp pipeline width Decoder enable
0 : disable, external mode
1 : enable,  pipeline mode,Post-processing pipeline with decoder

bit_ranges.name: SW_PP_CLKGATE_EN
bit_ranges.description:
pp auto clock gating:
default is 1
0 : don't auto gating
1 : audo gating
PP dynamic clock gating enable:
1 = Clock is gated from PP structures that are not used
0 = Clock is running for all PP structures
Note: Clock gating value can be changed only when PP is not
enabled

bit_ranges.name: SW_DEINT_EN
bit_ranges.description:
Deinterlace enable flag
the input data should be interlaced format

bit_ranges.name: SW_PP_DEC_ST
bit_ranges.description:
post-processing start flag
after config other register,write 1 to start post-processing
operation,and hw will reset to 0 after it decodered a picture
should be under External mode.

bit_ranges.name: SW_REFBUF_PID
bit_ranges.description:
the pic id for reference buffer
The used reference picture ID for reference buffer usage

bit_ranges.name: SW_REFBUF_THRD
bit_ranges.description:
Reference buffer threshold value
Used shut down buffer

bit_ranges.name: SW_DEC_TILED_LSB
bit_ranges.description:
the enable for lsb tiled mode
0 : Tiled mode disable
1 : Tiled mode enabled for 8x4 tile size

bit_ranges.name: SW_DEC_ASCMD0_DIS
bit_ranges.description: the disable for AXI Single Command Multiple Data0

bit_ranges.name: SW_SKIP_SEL
bit_ranges.description:
AVS format:
0 : skip mbs use special MB type
1 : avs skip mbs have the same skip run syntax element as h264

bit_ranges.name: SW_DBLK_FLT_DIS
bit_ranges.description:
the disable for current pic deblock filtering
1: disable
0: enable

bit_ranges.name: SW_DEC_FIXED_QUANT
bit_ranges.description:
h.264:
this bit is for the enable of multi view coding
other format
0: it can be different inside pic for Quantization parameter
1: it is fixed for Quantization parameter

bit_ranges.name: SW_ADTION_LATENCY
bit_ranges.description:
the additional latency for decoder master interface
Can be used to slow down 8*sw_dec_latency cycles of IDLE
between services,so if sw_dec_latency =0,that is no latency

bit_ranges.name: SW_DEC_TILED_MSB
bit_ranges.description:
the enable for msb tiled mode
0 : Tiled mode disable
1 : Tiled mode enabled for 8x4 tile size

bit_ranges.name: SW_STRM_LEN
bit_ranges.description:
the stream data bytes number in input buffer.
if the buffer size be given small than it required,hw will give an
interrupt,and then you should config again,and the stream start
address should be config also.
VP6:
one picture/slice of the picture's should be included in the input
buffer
H264/H263/MPEG*:
one slice of the picture's should be included in the input buffer
JPEG:
256bytes or onepicture should be included in the input buffer

bit_ranges.name: SW_ADV_PREF_THRD
bit_ranges.description:
the threshold value for advanced prefetch
when current MB num > this threshold value,then advanced mode
will be closed

bit_ranges.name: SW_XDIM_MBST
bit_ranges.description:
the X dimension value for Start MB from SW
it may be used in error  concealment case

bit_ranges.name: SW_YDIM_MBST
bit_ranges.description:
the Y dimension value for Start MB from SW
it may be used in error  concealment case

bit_ranges.name: SW_DEC_FMT_SEL
bit_ranges.description:
the dec format select
0 : H.264,
1 : MPEG-4,
2 : H.263,
3 : JPEG,
4 : reserved
5 : MPEG-2,
6 : MPEG-1,
7 : VP6,
8 : RV,
9 : VP7,
10 : reserved
11 : AVS,
others : reserved

bit_ranges.name: SW_DEC_STRENDIAN_E
bit_ranges.description:
the endian mode of stream data
0 : Big endian (0-1-2-3 order)
1 : Little endian (3-2-1-0 order)

bit_ranges.name: SW_DEC_STRM_WORDSP
bit_ranges.description:
the 32bit data swap for stream data
it will be used in 64 bit environment
0 : no swapping
1 : swapping high and low 32bit data

bit_ranges.name: SW_DEC_OUT_WORDSP
bit_ranges.description:
the 32bit data swap for dec output data,
it will be used in 64 bit environment
0 : no swapping
1 : swapping high and low 32bit data

bit_ranges.name: SW_DEC_IN_WORDSP
bit_ranges.description:
the 32bit data swap for dec input data,
it will be used in 64 bit environment
0 : no swapping
1 : swapping high and low 32bit data
note : it no used for stream data

bit_ranges.name: SW_DEC_OUT_ENDIAN
bit_ranges.description:
the endian mode of dec output
Decoder output endian mode:
0 : Big endian (0-1-2-3 order)
1 : Little endian (3-2-1-0 order)

bit_ranges.name: SW_DEC_IN_ENDIAN
bit_ranges.description:
the endian mode of dec input
0 : Big endian (0-1-2-3 order)
1 : Little endian (3-2-1-0 order)
note : it no used for stream data

bit_ranges.name: SW_TIMEOUT_DET_STS
bit_ranges.description:
the Interrupt status bit for tell us  timeout detected
AXI in IDLE status too long

bit_ranges.name: SW_ERROR_DET_STS
bit_ranges.description:
the Interrupt status bit for tell us  error detected
Interrupt status bit input stream error. When high, an error is found
in input data stream decoding. HW will self reset.
(1,2,3,6,48,55,57)

bit_ranges.name: SW_BSLICE_DET_STS
bit_ranges.description: the Interrupt status bit for tell us  B slice be detected

bit_ranges.name: SW_SLICE_DET_STS
bit_ranges.description: the Interrupt status bit for tell us slice be decoded

bit_ranges.name: SW_ASO_DET_STS
bit_ranges.description:
the Interrupt status bit for tell us ASO detectet
ASO:Arbitrary Slice Ordering

bit_ranges.name: SW_BUF_EMT_STS
bit_ranges.description: the Interrupt status bit for tell input buffer empty

bit_ranges.name: SW_PP_BUS_STS
bit_ranges.description: the Interrupt status bit for tell sw bus have some error

bit_ranges.name: SW_DEC_RDY_STS
bit_ranges.description: the Interrupt status bit for tell sw processed a picture

bit_ranges.name: SW_DEC_IRQ_DIS
bit_ranges.description:
the decoder finish interrupt request diable flag
1 : use polling to see the interrupt
0 : use sw_pp_irq

bit_ranges.name: SW_DEC_IRQ
bit_ranges.description:
the decoder finish interrupt request
after sw query this interrupt,shoud write 0 to reset.

bit_ranges.name: SW_AXI_SEL
bit_ranges.description:
axi signals selected for encoder or decoder
0:  auto sel for encoder or decoder
1:  sel decoder  (only used in the middle decoder frame to set
bus_dec_en to 0)

bit_ranges.name: SW_DEC_DATA_DISCD_EN
bit_ranges.description:
enable for Data discard
the fixed burst length will be used ,and the more read datas will be
auto discarded by hw

bit_ranges.name: SW_BUS_POS_SEL
bit_ranges.description:
the parallel or serial mode for axi read and write
0:serial
1:parallel

bit_ranges.name: SW_DEC_MAX_BURLEN
bit_ranges.description:
the max burst length can be used by axi bus
range : 1-16

bit_ranges.name: SW_DEC_AXI_ID_WR
bit_ranges.description:
AXI Write ID
if you config 0,will modify as 1 by hw

bit_ranges.name: SW_DEC_AXI_ID_RD
bit_ranges.description:
AXI Read ID
if you config 0/5,will modify as 1 by hw

bit_ranges.name: SW_DEC_TIMEOUT_MODE
bit_ranges.description:
dec timeout mode selset
when 1'b0 , timeout cycle is 181'b1
when 1'b1,  timeout cycle is 221'b1

bit_ranges.name: SW_CACHE_EN
bit_ranges.description:
cache enable
1'b1: cache enable
1'b0: cache disable
when sw_cache_en is 1'b1, sw_pref_sigchan should also be 1'b1

bit_ranges.name: SW_PREF_SIGCHAN
bit_ranges.description:
prefetch single channel enable
1'b1: prefetch single channel enable

bit_ranges.name: SW_INTRA_DBL3T
bit_ranges.description:
In chroma dc intra prediction, when this bit is enable, there will 3
cycle enhance for every block

bit_ranges.name: SW_INTRA_DBLSPEED
bit_ranges.description:
intra double speed enable
Intra double speed enable

bit_ranges.name: SW_INTER_DBLSPEED
bit_ranges.description:
inter double speed enable
Inter double speed enable

bit_ranges.name: SW_ST_CODE_EXIST
bit_ranges.description:
existence flag for  stream start code
0 : not exist
1 : exist

bit_ranges.name: SW_ADDIT_CH_FMT_WEN
bit_ranges.description:
Enable for additional chrominance  data format writing
tiled mode should be disable,when this bit be used
decoder writes chrominance:  group of 8 pixels of Cb then
corresponding 8 pixels of Cr
Data is written to sw_dec_ch8pix_st_adr.

bit_ranges.name: SW_RLC_MODE_EN
bit_ranges.description:
enable for RLC mode
0:decoder data come from bit stream(VLC mode),side information
1:decoder data come from RLC input data,only h.264 and MPEG4
sp be valid

bit_ranges.name: SW_PROG_JPEG_EN
bit_ranges.description:
enable flag for Progressive JPEG
0 : baseline JPEG
1 : progressive JPEG

bit_ranges.name: SW_CURPIC_CODE_SEL
bit_ranges.description:
the  current picture coding mode select
0 : progressive
1 : interlaced

bit_ranges.name: SW_CURPIC_STRU_SEL
bit_ranges.description:
the current picture Structure selected
0 : frame structure, (that isMBAFF structured picture is interlaced)
1 : field structure

bit_ranges.name: SW_PIC_TYPE_SEL1
bit_ranges.description:
pic type sel1 flag
0:desided by sw_pic_type_sel0
1: picture type is BI/D/B
note:
D is for mpeg1
B is for h264

bit_ranges.name: SW_PIC_TYPE_SEL0
bit_ranges.description:
pic type sel0 flag
should need sw_pic_type_sel1=0
0: Intra type (I)
1:Inter type (P)

bit_ranges.name: SW_PIC_DECFIELD_SEL
bit_ranges.description:
select which field will be decodered
0 : bottom field
1 : top field

bit_ranges.name: SW_FWD_REFPIC_MODE_SEL
bit_ranges.description:
progressive and interlaced for coding mode
used for forward reference picture:
0 : progressive
1 : interlaced
the backward reference picture is the same as current picture

bit_ranges.name: SW_SORSPA_EN
bit_ranges.description:
enable flag for Sorenson Sparc
valid when  sw_dec_fmt_sel= MPEG- 4
0 = disabled
1 = enable
if enable,will use Sorenson escape coding to compatible stream for
h.263

bit_ranges.name: SW_DMMV_WR_EN
bit_ranges.description:
enable flag for Direct mode motion vector write current picture
0:disable
1:enable
this bit used in MPEG2 or VP6 is for the purpose error concealment
case.
this bit used in h264 is for the purpose write DPB case with the
corresponding reference picture.
this bit used in other decoder format is for the purpose writing to
external memory starting from mv start address

bit_ranges.name: SW_REFTOP_EN
bit_ranges.description:
enable flag for reference top field
0 = bottom field
1 = top field

bit_ranges.name: SW_FIRST_REFTOP_EN
bit_ranges.description:
enable flag for FWD reference top field have been decoded first
0 : FWD reference bottom field
1 : FWD reference top field

bit_ranges.name: SW_SEQU_MBAFF_EN
bit_ranges.description:
the enable flag for Sequence includes MBAFF coded pictures
0:disable
1:enable

bit_ranges.name: SW_RD_CNT_TAB_EN
bit_ranges.description:
the enable flag for reading Picture order count table
read data from memory used
0:disable
1:enable (hw will read pic order counts)

bit_ranges.name: SW_TIMEOUT_STS_EN
bit_ranges.description:
the enable flag for Timeout interrupt
0:disable
1:enable (if hw can be working status too long,you will get an
timeout interrupt)

bit_ranges.name: SW_DEC_CLKGATE_EN
bit_ranges.description:
the enable flag for Decoder auto clock gating
default hw will reset to 1
0:disable
1:enable

bit_ranges.name: SW_DEC_WR_EXTMEM_DIS
bit_ranges.description:
disable flag for wiriting decoder output data to external memory
0 : enable
1:disable(no write to external memory)

bit_ranges.name: SW_REFPIC_BUF2_EN
bit_ranges.description:
enable flag for Refer picture buffer 2
0:disable
1:enable (should : pic size > QVGA)

bit_ranges.name: SW_DEC_ST_WORK
bit_ranges.description:
enable flag for decoder to start working
hw will auto reset this be after a frame be decodered no matter it
right or have some error

bit_ranges.name: SW_SOFT_RST
bit_ranges.description:
the soft reset for decoder or pp or encoder
write 1 to reset,and it will auto reset to 0 after one cycle

registers.name: VDPU_SWREG59
registers.description: H264, MPEG4, VP6 Prediction filter tap

bit_ranges.name: SW_ADDIT_CH_ST_ADR
bit_ranges.description:
the start address for additional chrominance data format
The usage is  enabled by sw_addit_ch_fmt_wen

bit_ranges.name: SW_QTABLE_ST_ADR
bit_ranges.description:
standard dependent tables start address
JPEG        :  AC,DC, QP tables
MPEG4/2  : QP table
H.264        :various tables
VP6/7/8     : stream decoding tables

registers.name: VDPU_SWREG62

bit_ranges.name: SW_DMMV_ST_ADR
bit_ranges.description:
Direct mode motion vector write/read start address
H264:
Direct mode motion vector write/read start address
Progressive JPEG:
the start address for ACDC coefficient read/write
If current round is for DC components :
this start address is pointing to luminance
AC component rounds:
this start address is used for current type

registers.description: Direct mode motion vector write/read start address

registers.name: VDPU_SWREG63

bit_ranges.name: SW_DEC_OUT_ST_ADR
bit_ranges.description:

video:
write decoder output picture or field start address
JPEG snapshot:
wirete decoder output luminance picture start address

registers.description: write decoder output picture or field start address

bit_ranges.name: SW_RLC_VLC_ST_ADR

rlc or vlc mode input data start addr

RLC data  start address
VLC mode:
Stream start address
HW return value of last_byte_address by this register to tell
where stream has been read when you get some abnormality
interrupt,may be used for debug
VP7:
DCT stream for MB rows 0,2n  start address

registers.description: rlc or vlc mode input data start addr

allowed)

bit_ranges.name: SW_REFBUF_IDCAL_E

row,
that picture_id is used for reference buffer fill for rest of the
picture

if intra prediction uses only neighbouring intra macroblocks
0 : neighbouring inter macroblocks are used in intra prediction
process
1 : neighbouring intra macroblocks are used

bit_ranges.name: H264_SCL_MATRIX_EN

scaling matrix enable
0 : normal transform
1 : use scaling matrix for transform

bit_ranges.name: H264_FIELDPIC_FLAG_EXIST
bit_ranges.description:

Flag for streamd that field_pic_flag exists in stream

bit_ranges.name: MFR_REG0
bit_ranges.description:
multi format reuse register0 except h264
MPEG4/JPEG/MPEG2/VP6/RV/VP7/VP:
[31:2]
RLC mode: Base address for RLC data
VLC mode: Stream start address
VP7:
[31:2]
This base address is used as sw_dct_strm0_base including DCT
stream for MB rows 0,2n

bit_ranges.name: MFR_REG1
bit_ranges.description:
multi format reuse register1 except h264
RV:
[20:16] :  frame size length
JPEG:
[26:0]    :  progressive JPEG
MPEG2 :
[12]       :  enable for bilinear motion compensation
VP7:
[31:26]  :  DCT stream partition index 1 of start bit
[25:20]  :  DCT stream partition index 2 of start bit
[13]       : rominance motion vector resolution for VP7/8
[12]       :  enable for bilinear motion compensation
[11:9]    : 0st count for DC prediction mach
[8:6]      : 1st count for DC prediction mach

bit_ranges.name: MFR_REG2
bit_ranges.description:
multi format reuse register2 except h264
MPEG4:
[31:26]   : Exact bit of stream start word
[25]        : enable for sync markers
[24]        : enable for Type 1 quantization
[23:19]   : the offset of Qp filter
[18:14]   : the offset of Qp filter for cr
[0]          : filed_pic_flag exists in stream
JPEG  :
[31:26]   :  Exact bit of stream start word
[25]        :  enable for sync markers
[12:11]   :  total of Quantization tables
[10:8]     :  the sampling format for input pic
[7]          :  JPEG width
[6]          :  weather current strem buffer contain the end of a
JPEG image
[5:0]       : vlc table
vp6:
[23:18]   : start bit for ctrl stream (vp7)
[17]        : enable for huffman decoding
[16]        : enable for muti stream (vp7)
[15:8]     : boolean dec init value(vp7)
[7:0]       : boolean dec init range

bit_ranges.name: MFR_REG3
bit_ranges.description:
multi format reuse register3 except h264
JPEG:
[15:0]    :  start marker frequency.
vp6:
[17:14]  :    loop filter limit value
[13]       :    enable for  variance test
[12:10]  :    filter MV size threshold
[9:0]      :    filter variance threshold
VP7/VP :
[31:16]   :   value 0 for inital dc predictor
[15:0]     :   value 1 for inital dc predictor

bit_ranges.name: MFR_REG4
bit_ranges.description:
multi format reuse register4 except h264
MPEG4:
[31:2]     :   MB ctrl start address
VP6:
[23:0]     :  total of CTRL stream data
VP7/VP  :
[27:24]   :  coeffient partitions number
[23:0]     :   total of CTRL stream data

bit_ranges.name: PERFCNT_SRC0
bit_ranges.description:
This register holds all the possible source values for Performance
Counter 0
0: disabled
1: total clock cycles
2: active clock cycles
3: read transactions, master
4: word reads, master
5: read transactions, slave
6: word reads, slave
7: read hit, slave
8: read misses, slave
9: read invalidates, slave
10: cacheable read transactions, slave
11: bad hit nmber, slave

bit_ranges.name: PERFCNT_SRC1
bit_ranges.description:
This register holds all the possible source values for Performance
Counter 1
0: disabled
1: total clock cycles
2: active clock cycles
3: read transactions, master
4: word reads, master
5: read transactions, slave
6: word reads, slave
7: read hit, slave
8: read misses, slave
9: read invalidates, slave
10: cacheable read transactions, slave
11: bad hit nmber, slave

summary.name: PREF_CACHE_ENABLE
summary.description: enables cacheable accesses and cache read allocation

bit_ranges.name: SW_RST_HANDSAVE_P
bit_ranges.description:
it would save protect-rstn into initial status if long time dead in
protect-rstn status. (auto clear into '0')

bit_ranges.name: SW_RST_PROTECT_E
bit_ranges.description:
protect-rstn mode enable.
it would be ensure all axi write/read operation into completion
status when sw_cclk_sreset_p or sw_aclk_sreset_p valid.

bit_ranges.name: SW_AUTO_RST
bit_ranges.description:
it would auto-resetn after one frame finish.
0: disable
1: enable

bit_ranges.name: SW_CCLK_SRESET_P
bit_ranges.description:
RGA core clk domain Soft reset, write '1' to this would reset the RGA
engine except config registers.

bit_ranges.name: SW_ACLK_SRESET_P
bit_ranges.description:
RGA aclk domain Soft reset, write '1' to this would reset the RGA
engine except config registers.

bit_ranges.name: SW_AUTO_CKG
bit_ranges.description:
RGA auto clock gating enable bit
0:disable
1:enable

bit_ranges.name: SW_CMD_OP_ST_P
bit_ranges.description:
RGA operation start bit
Only used in passive (slave) control mode

bit_ranges.name: SW_CMD_STOP
bit_ranges.description:
RGA command stop mode
Command execution would stop after the current graphic operation
finish if set this bit to 1

bit_ranges.name: SW_CMD_INCR_VALID_P
bit_ranges.description:
RGA command increment valid (Auto cleared)
When setting this bit,
1. The total cmd number would increase by the
RGA_INCR_CMD_NUM.
2. RGA would continue running if idle.

bit_ranges.name: SW_CMD_LINE_ST_P
bit_ranges.description:
RGA command line fetch start (command line reset) (Auto cleared)
When fetch start, the total cmd number would reset to
RGA_INCR_CMD_NUM.

bit_ranges.description:
When every bit HIGH, enable the writing corresponding bit
When every bit LOW, don't care the writing corresponding bit

bit_ranges.name: REG_LOAD_SYS_EN
bit_ranges.description:
vop system register config done flag
In the first setting of the register, the new value was saved into the
mirror register.
When all the system register config finish, writing this register to
enable the copyright of the mirror register to real register. Then
register would be updated at the start of every frame.

bit_ranges.name: REG_LOAD_WIN0_EN
bit_ranges.description:
vop win0 register config done flag
In the first setting of the register, the new value was saved into the
mirror register.
When all the win0 register config finish, writing this register to
enable the copyright of the mirror register to real register. Then
register would be updated at the start of every frame.

bit_ranges.name: REG_LOAD_EN
bit_ranges.description:
vop register config done flag
In the first setting of the register, the new value was saved into the
mirror register.
When all the register config finish, writing this register to enable the
copyright of the mirror register to real register. Then register would
be updated at the start of every frame.

bit_ranges.name: AUTO_GATING_EN

bit_ranges.name: VOPB_STANDBY_EN
bit_ranges.description:
LCDC standby mode
Writing "1" to turn LCDC into standby mode, All the layer would
disable and the data transfer from frame buffer memory would stop
at the end of current frame.
The output would be blank.
When writing "0" to this bit, standby mode would disable and the
LCDC go back to work immediately.
1'b0 : disable
1'b1 : enable
* Black display is recommended before setting standby mode
enable.

bit_ranges.name: VOPB_DMA_STOP
bit_ranges.description:
VOP DMA stop mode
1'b0 : disable
1'b1 : enable
* If DMA is working, the stop mode would not be active until current
bus transfer is finished.

bit_ranges.name: DSP_OUT_MODE
bit_ranges.description:
Display output format
4'b0000: Parallel 24-bit RGB888 output
R[7:0],G[7:0],B[7:0]
4'b0001: Parallel 18-bit RGB666 output
6'b0,R[5:0],G[5:0],B[5:0]
4'b0010: Parallel 16-bit RGB565 output
8'b0,R[4:0],G[5:0],B[4:0]
4'b0011: Parallel 24-bit RGB888 double pixel mix out
phase0:G1[3:0],B1[7:0],G0[3:0],B0[7:0]
phase1:R1[7:0],G1[7:4],R0[7:0],G0[7:4]
4'b0100: Serial 2x12-bit
12'b0,G[3:0],B[7:0] + 12'b0,R[7:0],G[7:4]
4'b0101: ITU-656 output mode0
16'b0,pixel_data[7:0]
4'b0110: ITU-656 output mode1
8'b0,pixel_data[7:0],8'b0
4'b0111: ITU-656 output mode2
9'b0,pixel_data[7:0],7'b0
4'b1000: Serial 3x8-bit RGB888
16'b0, B[7:0]+16'b0,G[7:0]+16'b0,R[7:0]
4'b1001: Serial 3x8-bit RGB888 + dummy
16'b0, B[7:0]+16'b0,G[7:0]+16'b0,R[7:0] + dummy
4'b1110:  YUV420 output for HDMI
4'b1100:  DP_YUV422
4'b1101:  DP_YUV420
4'b1111: Parallel 30-bit RGBaaa output
R[9:0],G[9:0],B[9:0]
Others: Reserved.

bit_ranges.name: WIN1_VS_FACTOR_YRGB
bit_ranges.description:
Win1 YRGB vertical scaling factor:
factor=((LCDC_WIN1_ACT_INFO[31:16])
/(LCDC_WIN1_DSP_INFO[31:16]))*2^12

bit_ranges.name: WIN1_HS_FACTOR_YRGB
bit_ranges.description:
Win1 YRGB horizontal scaling factor:
factor=((LCDC_WIN1_ACT_INFO[15:0])
/(LCDC_WIN1_DSP_INFO[15:0]))*2^12

bit_ranges.name: WIN1_VS_FACTOR_CBR
bit_ranges.description:
Win1 CBR vertical scaling factor:
YCbCr420:
factor=((LCDC_WIN1_ACT_INFO[31:16]/ 2)
/(LCDC_WIN1_DSP_INFO[31:16] ))*2^12
YCbCr422,YCbCr444:
factor=((LCDC_WIN1_ACT_INFO[31:16])
/(LCDC_WIN1_DSP_INFO[31:16] ))*2^12

bit_ranges.name: WIN1_HS_FACTOR_CBR
bit_ranges.description:
Win1 Cbr horizontal scaling factor:
YCbCr422,YCbCr420:
factor=((LCDC_WIN1_ACT_INFO[15:0]/2)
/(LCDC_WIN1_DSP_INFO[15:0]))*2^12
YCbCr444:
factor=((LCDC_WIN1_ACT_INFO[15:0])
/(LCDC_WIN1_DSP_INFO[15:0]))*2^12

bit_ranges.name: RPT
bit_ranges.description:
Repeat Counter
This field defines the repeated effective periods of output waveform
in one-shot mode. The value N means N+1 repeated effective
periods.

bit_ranges.name: SCALE
bit_ranges.description:
Scale Factor
This fields defines the scale factor applied to prescaled clock. The
value N means the clock is divided by 2*N. If N is 0, it means that
the clock is divided by 512(2*256).

bit_ranges.name: PRESCALE
bit_ranges.description:
Prescale Factor
This field defines the prescale factor applied to input clock. The
value N means that the input clock is divided by 2^N.

bit_ranges.name: CLK_SEL
bit_ranges.description:
Clock Source Select
1'b0: non-scaled clock is selected as PWM clock source. It means
that the prescale clock is directly used as the PWM clock source
1'b1: scaled clock is selected as PWM clock source

bit_ranges.name: LP_EN
bit_ranges.description:
Low Power Mode Enable
1'b0: disabled
1'b1: enabled
When PWM channel is inactive state and Low Power Mode is
enabled, the path to PWM Clock prescale module is blocked to
reduce power consumption.

bit_ranges.name: OUTPUT_MODE
bit_ranges.description:
PWM Output mode
1'b0: left aligned mode
1'b1: center aligned mode

bit_ranges.name: INACTIVE_POL
bit_ranges.description:
Inactive State Output Polarity
This defines the output waveform polarity when PWM channel is in
inactive state. The inactive state means that PWM finishes the
complete waveform in one-shot mode or PWM channel is disabled.
1'b0: negative
1'b1: positive

bit_ranges.name: DUTY_POL
bit_ranges.description:
Duty Cycle Output Polarity
This defines the polarity for duty cycle. PWM starts the output
waveform with duty cycle.
1'b0: negative
1'b1: positive

bit_ranges.name: PWM_MODE
bit_ranges.description:
PWM Operation Mode
2'b00: One shot mode.  PWM produces the waveform within the
repeated times defined by PWMx_CTRL_rpt .
2'b01: Continuous mode. PWM produces the waveform
continuously
2'b10: Capture mode. PWM measures the cycles of high/low
polarity of input waveform.
2'b11: reserved

bit_ranges.name: PWM_EN
bit_ranges.description:
PWM channel enable
1'b0: disabled
1'b1: enabled. If the PWM is worked the one-shot mode, this bit will
be cleared at the  end of operation

registers.name: VOPB_PWM_PERIOD_HPR

bit_ranges.name: PWM_PERIOD
bit_ranges.description:
Output Waveform Period/Input Waveform High Polarity Cycle
If PWM is operated at the continuous mode or one-shot mode, this
value defines the period of the output waveform. Note that, if the
PWM is operated at the center-aligned mode, the period should be
an even one, and therefore only the bit [31:1] is taken into account
and bit [0] always considered as 0.
If PWM is operated at the capture mode, this value indicates the
effective high polarity cycles of input waveform. This value is based
on the PWM clock.
The value ranges from 0 to (2^32-1).

registers.description: PWM Period Register/High Polarity Capture Register

registers.name: VOPB_PWM_DUTY_LPR

bit_ranges.name: PWM_DUTY
bit_ranges.description:
Output Waveform Duty Cycle/Input Waveform Low Polarity Cycle
If PWM is operated at the continuous mode or one-shot mode, this
value defines the duty cycle of the output waveform. The PWM
starts the output waveform with duty cycle. Note that, if the PWM is
operated at the center-aligned mode, the period should be an even
one, and therefore only the [31:1] is taken into account.
If PWM is operated at the capture mode, this value indicates the
effective low polarity cycles of input waveform.
This value is based on the PWM clock. The value ranges from 0 to
(2^32-1).

registers.description: PWM Duty Register/Low Polarity Capture Register

bit_ranges.name: PWM_CNT
bit_ranges.description:
Timer Counter
The 32-bit indicates current value of PWM Channel 0 counter. The
counter runs at the rate of PWM clock.
The value ranges from 0 to (2^32-1).

bit_ranges.name: REG_LOAD_SYS_EN
bit_ranges.description:
vop system register config done flag
In the first setting of the register, the new value was saved into the
mirror register.
When all the system register config finish, writing this register to
enable the copyright of the mirror register to real register. Then
register would be updated at the start of every frame.

bit_ranges.name: VOPL_STANDBY_EN
bit_ranges.description:
LCDC standby mode
Writing "1" to turn LCDC into standby mode, All the layer would
disable and the data transfer from frame buffer memory would stop
at the end of current frame.
The output would be blank.
When writing "0" to this bit, standby mode would disable and the
LCDC go back to work immediately.
1'b0 : disable
1'b1 : enable
* Black display is recommended before setting standby mode
enable.

bit_ranges.name: VOPL_DMA_STOP
bit_ranges.description:
VOP DMA stop mode
1'b0 : disable
1'b1 : enable
* If DMA is working, the stop mode would not be active until current
bus transfer is finished.

bit_ranges.name: WIN23_PRI_OPT_MODE
bit_ranges.description:
1'b0: win2 win3 dma priority enalbe
1'b1: win2 win3 dma priority disable

bit_ranges.name: MIPI_OUT_EN
bit_ranges.description:
1'b0 : gating output clk ,data and control signal
1'b1 : mipi interface enable

bit_ranges.name: EDP_OUT_EN
bit_ranges.description:
1'b0 : gating output clk ,data and control signal
1'b1 : edp interface enable

bit_ranges.name: HDMI_OUT_EN
bit_ranges.description:
1'b0 : gating output clk ,data and control signal
1'b1 : hdmi interface enable

bit_ranges.name: RGB_OUT_EN
bit_ranges.description:
1'b0 : gating output clk ,data and control signal
1'b1 : rgb/lvds interface enable

bit_ranges.name: DP_OUT_EN
bit_ranges.description:
1'b0 : gating output clk ,data and control signal
1'b1 : dp interface enable

bit_ranges.name: EDPI_WMS_FS
bit_ranges.description:
edpi wms mode ,frame st signal
write "1": edpi_wms_mode frame start (when other register is
config done)
read : wms mode hold status

bit_ranges.name: DIRECT_PATH_LAYER_SEL
bit_ranges.description:
direct path layer select
2'b00 : select win0
2'b01 : select win1
2'b10 : select win2
2'b11 : select win3

bit_ranges.name: DIRECT_PATH_EN
bit_ranges.description:
iep direct path enable signal
1'b0 : disable iep direct path
1'b1 : enable iep direct path

bit_ranges.name: REG_DONE_FRM
bit_ranges.description:
1’b0: every frame valid
1’b1: every field valid

bit_ranges.name: NOC_HURRY_W_MODE
bit_ranges.description:
2'b00: noc_hurry_w disable
2'b01: left 1/4 fifo empty
2'b10: left 1/2 fifo empty
2'b11: left 3/4 fifo empty

bit_ranges.name: DSP_YUV_CLIP
bit_ranges.description:
YCrCb clip
1'b0 : disable, YCbCr no clip
1'b1 : enable, YCbCr clip before YCbCr2RGB
*Y clip: 16~235, CbCr clip: 16~239

bit_ranges.name: DSP_CCIR656_AVG
bit_ranges.description:
Cb-Cr filter in CCIR656 mode
1'b0 : drop mode
1'b1 : average mode

bit_ranges.name: DSP_BLACK_EN
bit_ranges.description:
Black display mode
When this bit enable, the pixel data output is all black
(0x000000)

bit_ranges.name: DSP_BLANK_EN
bit_ranges.description:
Blank display mode
When this bit enable, the Hsync/Vsync/Den output is blank

bit_ranges.name: DSP_OUT_ZERO
bit_ranges.description:
Hsync/Vsync/Den output software ctrl
1'b0 : normal output
1'b1 : all output '0'

bit_ranges.name: DSP_DUMMY_SWAP
bit_ranges.description:
Display dummy swap enable
1'b0 : B+G+R+dummy
1'b1 : dummy+B+G+R

bit_ranges.name: DSP_DELTA_SWAP
bit_ranges.description:
Display delta swap enable
1'b0 : disable
1'b1 : enable
*See detail description in Delta display charpter.

bit_ranges.name: DSP_RG_SWAP
bit_ranges.description:
Display output red and green swap enable
1'b0 : RGB
1'b1 : GRB

bit_ranges.name: DSP_RB_SWAP
bit_ranges.description:
Display output red and blue swap enable
1'b0 : RGB
1'b1 : BGR

bit_ranges.name: DSP_BG_SWAP
bit_ranges.description:
Display output blue and green swap enable
1'b0 : RGB
1'b1 : RBG

bit_ranges.name: DSP_FIELD_POL
bit_ranges.description:
field polarity when interlace dsp
1'b0 : normal
1'b1 : invert

bit_ranges.name: DSP_INTERLACE
bit_ranges.description:
Interlace display enable
1'b0 : disable
1'b1 : enable
*This mode is related to the ITU-R656 output, the display timing of
odd field must be set correctly.
(lcdc_dsp_vs_st_end_f1/lcdc_dsp_vact_end_f1)

bit_ranges.name: DSP_DDR_PHASE
bit_ranges.description:
dclk phase lock
1'b0 : no lock
1'b1 : lock every line

bit_ranges.name: SW_CORE_DCLK_SEL
bit_ranges.description:
1'b0: dclk_core sel dclk
1'b1: dclk_core sel dclk div2

bit_ranges.name: DSP_OUT_MODE
bit_ranges.description:
Display output format
4'b0000: Parallel 24-bit RGB888 output
R[7:0],G[7:0],B[7:0]
4'b0001: Parallel 18-bit RGB666 output
6'b0,R[5:0],G[5:0],B[5:0]
4'b0010: Parallel 16-bit RGB565 output
8'b0,R[4:0],G[5:0],B[4:0]
4'b0011: Parallel 24-bit RGB888 double pixel mix out
phase0:G1[3:0],B1[7:0],G0[3:0],B0[7:0]
phase1:R1[7:0],G1[7:4],R0[7:0],G0[7:4]
4'b0100: Serial 2x12-bit
12'b0,G[3:0],B[7:0] + 12'b0,R[7:0],G[7:4]
4'b0101: ITU-656 output mode0
16'b0,pixel_data[7:0]
4'b0110: ITU-656 output mode1
8'b0,pixel_data[7:0],8'b0
4'b0111: ITU-656 output mode2
9'b0,pixel_data[7:0],7'b0
4'b1000: Serial 3x8-bit RGB888
16'b0, B[7:0]+16'b0,G[7:0]+16'b0,R[7:0]
4'b1001: Serial 3x8-bit RGB888 + dummy
16'b0, B[7:0]+16'b0,G[7:0]+16'b0,R[7:0] + dummy
4'b1110:  YUV420 output for HDMI
4'b1100:  DP_YUV422
4'b1101:  DP_YUV420
4'b1111: Parallel 30-bit RGBaaa output
R[9:0],G[9:0],B[9:0]
Others: Reserved.

bit_ranges.name: MIPI_DCLK_POL

bit_ranges.name: RPT
bit_ranges.description:
Repeat Counter
This field defines the repeated effective periods of output waveform
in one-shot mode. The value N means N+1 repeated effective
periods.

bit_ranges.name: SCALE
bit_ranges.description:
Scale Factor
This fields defines the scale factor applied to prescaled clock. The
value N means the clock is divided by 2*N. If N is 0, it means that
the clock is divided by 512(2*256).

bit_ranges.name: PRESCALE
bit_ranges.description:
Prescale Factor
This field defines the prescale factor applied to input clock. The
value N means that the input clock is divided by 2^N.

bit_ranges.name: CLK_SEL
bit_ranges.description:
Clock Source Select
1'b0: non-scaled clock is selected as PWM clock source. It means
that the prescale clock is directly used as the PWM clock source
1'b1: scaled clock is selected as PWM clock source

bit_ranges.name: LP_EN
bit_ranges.description:
Low Power Mode Enable
1'b0: disabled
1'b1: enabled
When PWM channel is inactive state and Low Power Mode is
enabled, the path to PWM Clock prescale module is blocked to
reduce power consumption.

bit_ranges.name: OUTPUT_MODE
bit_ranges.description:
PWM Output mode
1'b0: left aligned mode
1'b1: center aligned mode

bit_ranges.name: INACTIVE_POL
bit_ranges.description:
Inactive State Output Polarity
This defines the output waveform polarity when PWM channel is in
inactive state. The inactive state means that PWM finishes the
complete waveform in one-shot mode or PWM channel is disabled.
1'b0: negative
1'b1: positive

bit_ranges.name: DUTY_POL
bit_ranges.description:
Duty Cycle Output Polarity
This defines the polarity for duty cycle. PWM starts the output
waveform with duty cycle.
1'b0: negative
1'b1: positive

bit_ranges.name: PWM_MODE
bit_ranges.description:
PWM Operation Mode
2'b00: One shot mode.  PWM produces the waveform within the
repeated times defined by PWMx_CTRL_rpt .
2'b01: Continuous mode. PWM produces the waveform
continuously
2'b10: Capture mode. PWM measures the cycles of high/low
polarity of input waveform.
2'b11: reserved

bit_ranges.name: PWM_EN
bit_ranges.description:
PWM channel enable
1'b0: disabled
1'b1: enabled. If the PWM is worked the one-shot mode, this bit will
be cleared at the  end of operation

registers.name: VOPL_PWM_PERIOD_HPR

bit_ranges.name: PWM_PERIOD
bit_ranges.description:
Output Waveform Period/Input Waveform High Polarity Cycle
If PWM is operated at the continuous mode or one-shot mode, this
value defines the period of the output waveform. Note that, if the
PWM is operated at the center-aligned mode, the period should be
an even one, and therefore only the bit [31:1] is taken into account
and bit [0] always considered as 0.
If PWM is operated at the capture mode, this value indicates the
effective high polarity cycles of input waveform. This value is based
on the PWM clock.
The value ranges from 0 to (2^32-1).

registers.description: PWM Period Register/High Polarity Capture Register

registers.name: VOPL_PWM_DUTY_LPR

bit_ranges.name: PWM_DUTY
bit_ranges.description:
Output Waveform Duty Cycle/Input Waveform Low Polarity Cycle
If PWM is operated at the continuous mode or one-shot mode, this
value defines the duty cycle of the output waveform. The PWM
starts the output waveform with duty cycle. Note that, if the PWM is
operated at the center-aligned mode, the period should be an even
one, and therefore only the [31:1] is taken into account.
If PWM is operated at the capture mode, this value indicates the
effective low polarity cycles of input waveform.
This value is based on the PWM clock. The value ranges from 0 to
(2^32-1).

registers.description: PWM Duty Register/Low Polarity Capture Register

bit_ranges.name: PWM_CNT
bit_ranges.description:
Timer Counter
The 32-bit indicates current value of PWM Channel 0 counter. The
counter runs at the rate of PWM clock.
The value ranges from 0 to (2^32-1).

bit_ranges.name: OUT_MODE
bit_ranges.description:

2'b11 : normal video
